   20: 
   21: -module(shell_docs_SUITE).
   22: -moduledoc false.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:    init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   26: 
   27: -export([render/1, links/1, normalize/1, render_prop/1,render_non_native/1]).
   28: -export([render_function/1, render_type/1, render_callback/1]).
   29: 
   30: -export([render_all/1, update_render/0, update_render/1]).
   31: 
   32: -export([execute/3]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("kernel/include/eep48.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{timetrap,{minutes,30}}].
   39: 
   40: all() ->
   41:     [ {group, render},
   42:       {group, prop}
   43:     ].
   44: 
   45: groups() ->
   46:     [ {prop,[],[render_prop]},
   47:       {render, [], [render, render_non_native, links, normalize]},
   48:       {render_smoke, [], [render_function, render_type, render_callback]}
   49:     ].
   50: 
   51: %% Include a spec here in order to test that specs of undocumented functions
   52: %% is rendered correctly.
   53: -spec init_per_suite(Config1) -> Config2 when
   54:       Config1 :: list({atom(),term()}),
   55:       Config2 :: list({atom(),term()}).
   56: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   57:     {ok, ?MODULE} = c:c(?MODULE,[debug_info]),
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   61:     ok.
   62: 
   63: init_per_group(prop, Config) ->
   64:     ct_property_test:init_per_suite(Config);
   65: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   66:     Config.
   67: 
   68: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: %% We keep the docs of a couple of complex modules
   72: %% in the data_dir in order to compare then with the original
   73: %% when we fix bugs so that we don't break anything.
   74: %%
   75: %% This testcase is always run so that we do now forget to
   76: %% check that any bugfix does not break the current behaviour.
   77: %%
   78: %% If you do a bugfix that does not break this testcase when
   79: %% fixed you should include that module in the list of modules
   80: %% tested.
   81: %%
   82: %% Currently the modules are:
   83: -define(RENDER_MODULES, [sofs, re, file, erlang, user_drv, ?MODULE]).
   84: %% If you need to update the definition because this
   85: %% testcase fails, just run update_render/0,1.
   86: render(Config) ->
   87: 
   88:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   89: 
   90:     lists:foreach(
   91:       fun(Module) ->
   92:               {ok, [D]} = file:consult(filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1")),
   93:               maps:map(
   94:                 fun(FName, Current) ->
   95:                         case file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir,FName)) of
   96:                             {ok, Original} when Original =:= Current ->
   97:                                 ok;
   98:                             {ok, Original} ->
   99:                                 ct:log("Original: ~n~ts",[Original]),
  100:                                 ct:log("Current : ~n~ts",[Current]),
  101:                                 ct:fail(output_changed);
  102:                             {error, enoent} ->
  103:                                 %% All modules are not available on all
  104:                                 %% platforms. For instance socket is not
  105:                                 %% available on windows.
  106:                                 ok
  107:                         end
  108:                 end, render_module(Module, D))
  109:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  110: 
  111: update_render() ->
  112:     update_render(
  113:       filename:join([os:getenv("ERL_TOP"),
  114:                      "lib", "stdlib", "test", "shell_docs_SUITE_data"])).
  115: update_render(DataDir) ->
  116:     lists:foreach(
  117:       fun(Module) ->
  118:               case code:get_doc(Module) of
  119:                   {ok, D} ->
  120:                       ok = file:write_file(
  121:                              filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1"),
  122:                              io_lib:format("~w.",[D])),
  123:                       maps:map(
  124:                         fun(FName, Output) ->
  125:                                 ok = file:write_file(filename:join(DataDir, FName), Output)
  126:                         end, render_module(Module, D));
  127:                   E ->
  128:                       io:format("Error processing: ~p ~p",[Module, E])
  129:               end
  130:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  131: 
  132: handle_error({error,_}) ->
  133:   ok;
  134: handle_error(Doc) ->
  135:   unicode:characters_to_binary(Doc).
  136: 
  137: only_if_smp(Func) ->
  138:     only_if_smp(4, Func).
  139: only_if_smp(Schedulers, Func) ->
  140:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  141:       N when N < Schedulers -> {skip,"Too few schedulers online"};
  142:       _ -> Func()
  143:     end.
  144: 
  145: %%
  146: %% Render function
  147: %%
  148: %% This function tests that OTP code base can print its documentation
  149: %% in the shell. It is a time consuming operation that can take
  150: %% up-to 40 - 50 min if run in a single processor (1 scheduler config) machine.
  151: %%
  152: %% Skip the test case when running in a machine with not enough SMP.
  153: %%
  154: %% OBS. render_type/render_callback have shorter times and do not need
  155: %%      to be skipped, regardless of the number of available schedulers.
  156: %% 
  157: render_function(_Config) ->
  158:   only_if_smp(fun render_function_do/0).
  159: 
  160: render_function_do() ->
  161:     docsmap(
  162:       fun(Mod, D) ->
  163:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  164:               Exports = try Mod:module_info(exports)
  165:                         catch _:undef -> []
  166:                         end, %% nif file not available on this platform
  167:               pmap(
  168:                 fun(Config) ->
  169:                         try
  170:                             handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Config)),
  171:                             [try
  172:                                  handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, F, A, DHTML, Config))
  173:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  174:                                      io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  175:                                                [Mod,F,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_doc(Mod,F,A)]),
  176:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  177:                              end || {F,A} <- Exports]
  178:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  179:                                 io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  180:                                 exit(R)
  181:                         end
  182:                 end, format_configurations())
  183:       end),
  184:     ok.
  185: 
  186: render_type(_Config) ->
  187:     docsmap(
  188:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  189:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  190:               pmap(
  191:                 fun(Config) ->
  192:                         try
  193:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Config)),
  194:                           [try
  195:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  196:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  197:                                io:format("Failed to render type ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  198:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_type_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  199:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  200:                            end || {{type,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  201:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  202:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  203:                             exit(R)
  204:                         end
  205:                 end, format_configurations())
  206:       end),
  207:   ok.
  208: 
  209: render_callback(_Config) ->
  210:     docsmap(
  211:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  212:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  213:               pmap(
  214:                 fun(Config) ->
  215:                         try
  216:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Config)),
  217:                           [try
  218:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  219:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  220:                                io:format("Failed to render callback ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  221:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_callback_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  222:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  223:                            end || {{callback,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  224:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  225:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  226:                             exit(R)
  227:                         end
  228:                 end, format_configurations())
  229:       end),
  230:     ok.
  231: 
  232: docsmap(Fun) ->
  233:   F = fun F({Mod,_,_}) ->
  234:             F(Mod);
  235:           F(Mod) when is_list(Mod) ->
  236:             F(list_to_atom(Mod));
  237:           F(Mod) ->
  238:             case code:get_doc(Mod) of
  239:               {error, missing} ->
  240:                 ok;
  241:               {error, cover_compiled} ->
  242:                 ok;
  243:               {error, E} when E =:= eperm; E =:= eacces; E =:= eio ->
  244:                 %% This can happen in BSD's for some reason...
  245:                 ok;
  246:               {error, eisdir} ->
  247:                 %% Uhm?
  248:                 ok;
  249:               {ok, Docs} ->
  250:                 try
  251:                   _ = Fun(Mod, Docs),
  252:                   {ok, self(), Mod}
  253:                 catch E:R:ST ->
  254:                     io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p:~p~n",[Mod,E,R,ST]),
  255:                     erlang:raise(E,R,ST)
  256:                 end
  257:             end
  258:       end,
  259:   lists:foreach(F, code:all_available()),
  260:   ok.
  261: 
  262: 
  263: format_configurations() ->
  264:   [#{},
  265:    #{ ansi => false },
  266:    #{ ansi => true },
  267:    #{ columns => 5 },
  268:    #{ columns => 150 },
  269:    #{ encoding => unicode },
  270:    #{ encoding => latin1 }].
  271: 
  272: markdown_to_shelldoc(#docs_v1{format = Format}=Docs) ->
  273:     DefaultFormat = <<"text/markdown">>,
  274:     DFormat = binary_to_list(DefaultFormat),
  275:     case Format of
  276:         _ when Format =:= DefaultFormat orelse Format =:= DFormat ->
  277:             ModuleDoc = Docs#docs_v1.module_doc,
  278:             Doc = Docs#docs_v1.docs,
  279:             Docs#docs_v1{format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT,
  280:                          module_doc = process_moduledoc(ModuleDoc),
  281:                          docs = process_doc_attr(Doc)};
  282:         _  ->
  283:             Docs
  284:     end.
  285: 
  286: -spec process_moduledoc(Doc :: map() | none | hidden) -> map() | none | hidden.
  287: process_moduledoc(Doc) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  288:     Doc;
  289: process_moduledoc(Doc) when is_map(Doc) ->
  290:     maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc).
  291: 
  292: process_doc_attr(Doc) ->
  293:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Doc).
  294: 
  295: process_doc(Docs) when is_list(Docs) ->
  296:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Docs);
  297: process_doc({_At, _A, _S, Doc, _M}=Entry) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  298:     Entry;
  299: process_doc({Attributes, Anno, Signature, Doc, Metadata}) ->
  300:     Docs = maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc),
  301:     {Attributes, Anno, Signature, Docs, Metadata}.
  302: 
  303: 
  304: render_prop(Config) ->
  305: %    dbg:tracer(),dbg:p(all,c),dbg:tpl(shell_docs_prop,[]),
  306:     ct_property_test:quickcheck(
  307:       shell_docs_prop:prop_render(),Config).
  308: 
  309: links(_Config) ->
  310:     docsmap(
  311:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ module_doc = MDoc, docs = Docs, format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT }) ->
  312:               try
  313:                   [check_links(Mod, maps:get(<<"en">>,MDoc)) || MDoc =/= none, MDoc =/= hidden]
  314:               catch _E1:R1:ST1 ->
  315:                       io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  316:                                 [Mod,R1,ST1,MDoc]),
  317:                       erlang:raise(error,R1,ST1)
  318:               end,
  319:               [try
  320:                   check_links(Mod, D)
  321:                catch _E:R:ST ->
  322:                        io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  323:                                  [Mod,Kind,R,ST,D]),
  324:                        erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  325:                end || {Kind,_Anno,_Sig,#{ <<"en">> := D },_MD} <- Docs];
  326:          (Mod, #docs_v1{ format = Fmt }) ->
  327:               io:format("Skipping ~p because format is ~ts~n",
  328:                         [Mod, Fmt])
  329:       end).
  330: 
  331: check_links(Mod, [{a,Attr,C}|T]) ->
  332:     case proplists:get_value(rel,Attr) of
  333:         <<"https://erlang.org/doc/link/seemfa">> ->
  334:             case string:lexemes(proplists:get_value(href, Attr),":#/") of
  335:                 [_App,TargetMod,Func,Arity] ->
  336:                     case code:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod)) of
  337:                         {ok, _ModDoc} ->
  338:                             case shell_docs:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod),
  339:                                                     b2a(Func),
  340:                                                     binary_to_integer(Arity)) of
  341:                                 [] -> throw({could_not_find,b2a(TargetMod),
  342:                                                 b2a(Func),
  343:                                                 binary_to_integer(Arity)});
  344:                                 _Else  -> ok
  345:                             end;
  346:                         _Else ->
  347:                             throw({could_not_find, TargetMod, Attr})
  348:                     end;
  349:                 _Callback ->
  350:                     ok
  351:             end;
  352:         _OtherlinkType ->
  353:             ok
  354:     end,
  355:     check_links(Mod, C),
  356:     check_links(Mod, T);
  357: check_links(Mod, [{_,_,C}|T]) ->
  358:     check_links(Mod, C),
  359:     check_links(Mod, T);
  360: check_links(Mod, [C|T]) when is_binary(C) ->
  361:     check_links(Mod, T);
  362: check_links(_, []) ->
  363:     ok.
  364: 
  365: normalize(_Config) ->
  366:     ?assertMatch(
  367:        [{p,[],[{em,[],[<<"a ">>,{code,[],[<<"b ">>]},<<"c">>]}]}],
  368:        shell_docs:normalize([{p,[],[{em,[],[<<" a ">>,{code,[],[<<" b  ">>]},<<" c">>]}]}])
  369:       ),
  370:     ?assertMatch(
  371:        [{'div',[],[<<"!">>]}],
  372:        shell_docs:normalize([{'div',[],[{code,[],[<<" ">>,{i,[],[<<" ">>]}]},<<" !">>]}])
  373:       ),
  374:     ok.
  375: 
  376: %% Special binary_to_atom that deals with <<"'and'">>
  377: b2a(Bin) ->
  378:     case erl_scan:string(binary_to_list(Bin)) of
  379:         {ok,[{atom,_,A}],_} -> A;
  380:         {ok,[{A,_}],_} -> A
  381:     end.
  382: 
  383: %% Test rendering of non-native modules
  384: render_non_native(_Config) ->
  385:     Docs = #docs_v1{
  386:         anno = erl_anno:new(13),
  387:         beam_language = not_erlang,
  388:         format = <<"text/asciidoc">>,
  389:         module_doc = #{<<"en">> => <<"This is\n\npure text">>},
  390:         docs = []
  391:     },
  392: 
  393:     <<"\n\tnot_an_erlang_module\n\n"
  394:       "    This is\n"
  395:       "    \n"
  396:       "    pure text\n">> =
  397:         unicode:characters_to_binary(
  398:           shell_docs:render(not_an_erlang_module, Docs, #{ ansi => false })),
  399: 
  400:     ok.
  401: 
  402: %% Testing functions
  403: render_all(Dir) ->
  404:     file:make_dir(Dir),
  405:     %% We load all possible application in order to be able to use
  406:     %% application:get_application to get the application a module
  407:     %% belongs to.
  408:     PossibleApplications =
  409:         lists:flatmap(
  410:           fun(P) ->
  411:                   filelib:wildcard(filename:join(P, "*.app"))
  412:           end, code:get_path()),
  413:     [application:load(list_to_atom(filename:basename(filename:rootname(App)))) ||
  414:         App <- PossibleApplications],
  415:     docsmap(fun(Mod, D) ->
  416:                     maps:map(
  417:                       fun(FName, Value) ->
  418:                               file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, FName), Value)
  419:                       end, render_module(Mod, D))
  420:             end).
  421: 
  422: render_module(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  423:     Opts = #{ ansi => true, columns => 80, encoding => unicode },
  424:     case application:get_application(Mod) of
  425:         {ok, App} ->
  426:             App;
  427:         _ ->
  428:             App = unknown
  429:     end,
  430:     SMod = atom_to_list(App) ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Mod),
  431:     Files =
  432:         #{
  433:           SMod ++ ".txt" =>
  434:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Opts)),
  435:           SMod ++ "_type.txt" =>
  436:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Opts)),
  437:           SMod ++ "_cb.txt" =>
  438:                     unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Opts))
  439:          },
  440:     lists:foldl(
  441:       fun({_Type,_Anno,_Sig,none,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  442:               Acc;
  443:          ({{function,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  444:               FAName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_func.txt",
  445:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_func.txt",
  446:               FADocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts)),
  447:               FDocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, D, Opts)),
  448:               case string:equal(FADocs,FDocs) of
  449:                   true -> 
  450:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs };
  451:                   false ->
  452:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs,
  453:                             sanitize(FName) => FDocs}
  454:               end;
  455:          ({{type,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  456:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_type.txt",
  457:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  458:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))};
  459:          ({{callback,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  460:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_cb.txt",
  461:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  462:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))}
  463:       end, Files, Docs).
  464: 
  465: sanitize(FName) ->
  466:     lists:foldl(
  467:       fun({Re,Replace}, Txt) ->
  468:               re:replace(Txt,Re,Replace,[global,{return,list}])
  469:       end, FName, [{"/","slash"},{":","colon"},
  470:                    {"\\*","star"},{"<","lt"},{">","gt"},{"=","eq"}]).
  471: 
  472: %%
  473: %% Parallel map function.
  474: %%
  475: %% Parallel map function that discards the result of the function
  476: %% `F` applied to each of the items in `Ls`. It spawns as many
  477: %% processes as items there are in `Ls`. If the list is large,
  478: %% consider adding a set of working processes that round-robin on
  479: %% the job to do be done.
  480: %%
  481: %% - `F` is the function to perform
  482: %% - `Ls` the list of items to iterate on
  483: %%
  484: pmap(F, Ls) when is_function(F),
  485:                  is_list(Ls) ->
  486:   _ = lists:foreach(fun(Config) ->
  487:                         spawn_link(?MODULE, execute,[Config, F, self()])
  488:                    end, Ls),
  489:   ResponseCounter = length(Ls),
  490:   ok = sync(ResponseCounter),
  491:   ok.
  492: 
  493: execute(Item, F, Pid) ->
  494:   _ = F(Item),
  495:   Pid ! ok.
  496: 
  497: sync(0) ->
  498:   ok;
  499: sync(N) ->
  500:   receive
  501:     ok ->
  502:       sync(N-1)
  503:   end.
